description: Work began on the controversial Laos-China railway as crews started clearing the right-of-way in the ancient Lao city of Luang Prabang late December 2016, but questions over who will get the bulk of the jobs building the U.S. $6 billion project and how much people displaced by the construction will get paid still linger.
